posts.title: Palm Beach Luxury Real Estate, 4th Quarter Market Report
posts.author: Linda R. Olsson
posts.content:
Just Listed! 218 El Brillo Way -$23,900,000Dear Buyers, Sellers, Clients, and Friends…

Happy New Year! We are excited to ring in the New Year, and thankful we have the pleasure of working with you…We could not be more appreciative of your business. We have been uniting Extraordinary People with Exceptional Properties since 1989. We are proud to represent your best interests with professionalism…Your confidence in us means so much. With 5 Star Google reviews, we couldn’t be more proud. Thank you!

It is a pleasure to share our Fourth Quarter Market Report with you, we are all excited to ring in the New Year, as the Fourth Quarter had everyone holding their breath due to the Presidential Election and Holiday Festivities, which is clear by the amount of sales this quarter compared to the past three quarters in 2024.

Area 1: (Inlet Drive to Wells Road) 6 homes SOLD

Average price: $20,195,000 – Average per sq.ft. $3,059

Highest priced per sq.ft. 1446 N Ocean Blvd – $7,336

Lowest priced per sq.ft. 210 Jamaica Lane – $1,911

Area 2: (Wells Road to Worth Ave.) 7 homes SOLD

Average price: $13,990,750 – Average per sq.ft. $3,545

Highest priced per sq.ft. 322 Clarke Ave – $7,253

Lowest priced per sq.ft. 221 Atlantic Ave. – $2,365

Area 3: (Worth Avenue to Sloan’s Curve) 1 homes SOLD

Highest priced per sq.ft. 130 Algoma Road– $1,951

Area 2: CONDOS (Worth Avenue to Wells Road) 5 condos SOLD

Average price: $5,950,000 – Average per sq.ft. $2,476

Highest priced per sq.ft. 2 N Breakers Row N42 – $3,585

Lowest priced per sq.ft. 100 Sunrise Ave 517 – $1,782

This year promises to be strong! Palm Beach is the center of the World it seems with everyone focusing on Mar-a-Lago as the “Winter White House”, and we all know that Palm Beach provides all of us a glorious lifestyle of convenience, security, beauty, and a strong community of dedicated people. We are blessed to live in Paradise…The people make this community special as do the local businesses, restaurants and shops that make this Town so unique. I have personally had the pleasure of living in Palm Beach since 1998, and I cannot recommend it more. Everyone gets involved in what they love, there are so many options available to us…Lectures, Art Exhibits, Golf, Tennis, Boating, the Beach, etc…It’s just Wonderful!

posts.title: Palm Beach, First Quarter Market Report… Searching for an Agent to represent your best interests?
posts.author: Carolina Olsson
posts.content:
$24,800,000 – 1080 SOUTH OCEAN BLVD. WE REPRESENTED THE BUYERS

Dear Clients, Friends, Potential Buyers, and Sellers,

Specializing in Palm Beach Luxury Properties for Over 30 Years…We have been uniting extraordinary people with exceptional properties since 1989. Thanks to you, we enjoyed another successful Season…With 5 star Google reviews from our Buyers and Sellers, we couldn’t be more proud…Thank you!

We are pleased to present our 1st Quarter Market Report for your review. It’s been another fabulous quarter for our firm…We represented the Buyers of 1080 South Ocean Blvd, Palm Beach in their purchase of this stunning new residence with Ocean Views in the Estate Section (Area 3), which was listed at $24.8 million and closed at $21.8 million. The below quote is the testimonial we received from the Buyer of this oceanfront estate…”As an attorney looking to relocate to Palm Beach my lucky day was when I found Linda Olsson. She is the consummate intelligent pro who brought insights and strategy to every element of her plan to help us get the best value on the home we selected, the home of our dreams. Right off, her knowledge of the market fundamentals and its microtrends proved indispensable in weeding out properties during our selection process. And when I saw Linda step into the negotiating ring it became obvious that we were going to prevail on price. If I could give just one piece of advice it would be to call Linda now just to meet her and discover certain opportunities that you most likely wouldn’t know about. “Thank you!

We also put 130 Cocoanut Row, Palm Beach under contract…A renovated Monterey-Style residence designed by John Volk in 1928 located in Town (Area 2), which is closing in June. Asking $17.9 million. Representing both Buyers and Sellers, we represent your best interests with professionalism and superior customer service.

Linda Olsson, Broker/Owner has been nationally recognized among the top 1,000 real estate professionals by the Wall Street Journal/Real Trends as “One of the  Best Real Estate Agents in the Country” ranked among the top 10 agents in Palm Beach. Thanks to superior customer service, in-depth knowledge of the market,  expert negotiation skills and a reputation you can trust, we are a leader among Palm Beach Real Estate Firms. Our Website, LindaOlsson.com , is unrivaled and  recognized as one of the best Real Estate Websites in the country and is the “Go To” site for Agents, Buyers and Sellers…Content includes featured properties, market reports,  customer testimonials, and our bi-monthly blog.

Contact Us for Experience you can Trust…We Get Results. Let our Expertise work for you!

posts.title: Are You Looking For A Fabulous Penthouse With Unrivaled Views? Look No Further!
posts.author: Carolina Olsson
posts.content:
We are proud to represent this Exclusive Grand Penthouse at The Plaza, it doesn’t get better than this…Please contact us to set up your private showing, it won’t last long. Reasonably priced at $8,250,000, this unit is unique, and it includes a rare, private, air-conditioned cabana with full bath, near the tennis court, and West pool. Preview the details, photos, and floor plan here. Contact us today, we are here for you 24/7!

First time on the market in 24 years, one of only four Grand Penthouses at The Plaza. Classic elegance abounds, boasting 12 ft. dome ceilings in the entry foyer leading into the grand living space with a fireplace at the focal point, complimenting the unparalleled panoramic views of the intracoastal, the island Palm Beach, and Atlantic Ocean. Chef’s kitchen, separate butler’s pantry, staff powder room, laundry room. and impact windows. Dining room and executive office with custom cabinetry and spectacular water views. Situated on a prestigious Flagler Drive, The Plaza’s 5 Star Service is unrivaled including 24-hour valet, two pools, a tennis court, pickleball, an exercise room, and a club room.

Specializing in Palm Beach Luxury Properties since 1989…Recognized by the Wall Street Journal as one of “America’s Best Real Estate Agents”, known for our professionalism, superior customer service and in-depth knowledge of the market. With over 30 years of experience selling Luxury Homes in Palm Beach, Linda and her associates have gained a vast knowledge of Palm Beach, its people, and its history…Knowledge we put to daily use to help our clients. The firm’s reputation and success are built upon experience, expertise, and five star customer service. Choosing a firm with the commitment, confidentiality, and dedication to represent your best interests makes all the difference. Your privacy is important to us. We take great pride in utilizing our experience, resources, and global connections on our unrivaled website to unite “Extraordinary People with Extraordinary Properties”. We were honored to have this fabulous article written by the Palm Beach Daily News when we celebrated our 25th year as a leader in Palm Beach Real Estate… “A Lifelong Commitment”, Click here to read the full article.

posts.title: Best Value in Town …Perfect North-End Beach House with Deeded Beach Access
posts.author: Carolina Olsson
posts.content:
Don’t miss this Palm Beach single family home buying opportunity!  New construction homes are difficult to find in Palm Beach, only three walls were remaining when Palm Beach Architect, Michel Perry, rebuilt this fabulous home for the current owner.

244 Orange Grove is well priced in today’s market. If you can locate a vacant lot on the North End of Palm Beach with high elevation on the South Side of the street it could cost a minimum of $8,000,000.  The last lot/tear down on Orange Grove in Palm Beach sold for $6.9 million. If you are thinking about building a new home in Palm Beach with a pool and two car garage of 3,900 sq. feet, the minimum cost would be $4.5 million to build it. In addition to that, it takes a tremendous amount of time, effort, and expense to go through the Palm Beach Building permit process to have it built, which in today’s market, a new build takes a minimum of approximately 24 months to complete.

It’s just not worth the time and money to build new... at $4.5 to build the new home, plus the cost of the lot…. at a minimum of $8 million, if you can find one for sale in Palm Beach at that price, it would be a miracle…That is $11.5, which is the asking price of this fabulous newly constructed home!  You can move in today and start enjoying this lovely single story beach house immediately without  the hassle and the time spent to build one… This house is the perfect beach house and it has deeded beach access too.

Schedule your showing Today! Click on this link to preview details and photos.

The Perfect Beach house, 244 Orange Grove…Unique single story home situated on a high elevation, South Exposure Lot with deeded Beach Access–Rare Find!

New construction throughout, reimagined by Palm Beach Architect, Michael Perry…This custom renovation took the original house down to the studs, with only three walls standing.

It’s almost a totally new construction home! The master bedroom suite was added on to the original structure, the entire roof was removed and rebuilt. 

This Modern home is built for today’s lifestyle… Everyone wants a Palm Beach Beach House, close to Town, with deeded beach access… It doesn’t get better than this!

Situated just North of the Clubs, this gracious 3 BD/ 3.5 BA, plus office, home has an inviting entry foyer with 11 foot ceilings and wide plank oak floors throughout. It’s   lovely double door entry leads to an open dining room, living room, and amazing custom kitchen, which opens the South exposure pool, and outdoor living space through three sets of French doors. The master suite and one guest bedroom overlook the private, lushly landscaped pool and entertaining space.

The custom kitchen features Wolf/Subzero appliances, wine cooler, beverage drawers, 8 burner stove/double oven and large pantry. Tankless water heater with heat pump, two car garage, and it’s generator ready too!

The location of this house is fabulous,…Situated on a quiet, North End Street, it is the ultimate Palm Beach Beach House, and the deeded beach access is truly a plus! Steps from the Beach, the Bike trail, and just a bike ride away from the Inlet, the Beach Club, Sailfish Club, and the Palm Beach Country Club.  The North End offers a variety of one and two story single family homes from the classic Bermuda to British West Indies ranging in size from 2,000 to 15,000 square feet with quiet streets and the best beaches in town. Known for its laid back lifestyle, Palm Beachers enjoy getting together at the neighborhood beach cabanas for barbecues and beach parties. The bike trail, which meanders for approximately 7 miles adjacent to the homes along the Intracoastal waterway, provides a safe place to walk, ride bikes, and just enjoy the scenery.  North End homes on the Intracoastal are perfect for boating enthusiasts requiring deep water dockage. It doesn’t get better than this… Just move in, relax and walk to the Beach!

Thinking about buying or Selling in Palm Beach? Contact us for Experience you can Trust! Specializing in Palm Beach Luxury Properties for Over 30 Years, with our Global Reach, Local Expertise, and an Unrivaled Web Site.  Recognized by the Wall Street Journal as one of “America’s Best Real Estate Agents”, known for our professionalism, superior customer service and in-depth knowledge of the market.  Representing buyers and sellers of Palm Beach’s finest residences… You can profit from our knowledge, expertise, and global presence.  We don’t just talk about excellence… We Get Results! With over 30 years of experience selling Luxury Homes in Palm Beach, Linda and her associates have gained a vast knowledge of Palm Beach, its people, and its history–knowledge we put to daily use to help our clients. The firm’s reputation and success are built upon experience, expertise, and excellent service.  Choosing a firm with the commitment, confidentiality, and dedication to represent your best interests makes all the difference. Your privacy is important to us. We take great pride in utilizing our experience, resources, and global connections to unite extraordinary people with extraordinary properties.

posts.title: Mid-Month Palm Beach Real Estate Market Update.. Featured In-Town Property for Sale or Lease
posts.author: Carolina Olsson
posts.content:
Dear Potential Buyers, Sellers, Clients, Colleagues and Friends,We hope all of you are enjoying an amazing summer, and we look forward to seeing you in the Fall. 

Since we reported our Second Quarter Market report on July 21, 2021, the Palm Beach Real Estate market continues to roar! I am sure you are reading all about it in the Wall Street Journal and in the article written by Jane Starr Drinkard, in which Jane interviewed me and published on August 4, 2021 in New York Magazine entitled “There are Barely any Houses left in Palm Beach“.  While inventory is low… The market is moving and moving fast!     

We are thankful for all our loyal clients, and the opportunity to serve all our buyers and sellers real estate needs.   We are delighted to report that yesterday we closed on a stunning architectural ocean-block gem at 167 Everglades Avenue, furnished for $17 million, and we put another fabulous home at 235 Garden Road under contract; asking $9.5 million, closing on October 15, 2021. Buyers are searching high and low for Palm Beach and West Palm Beach Condominiums too. 

We have several units under contract: 400 South Ocean Blvd., Sun and Surf/100 Sunrise Avenue, P.B. Towers/44 Cocoanut Row, 3360 South Ocean Blvd. and two units at La Clara, 1515 S. Flagler Drive, the new construction building in West Palm Beach. Rentals… Again, almost impossible to find! This home at 229 Pendleton Avenue on the Breaker’s Golf Course is now available for Sale or Annual or a long term (8 mth min) Seasonal Lease. See photos and details here.

This summer, my associates and I are here to help you. Typically traveling in the summer months, this year we are in Palm Beach, as so many of our buyers and sellers are ready to buy this summer to be sure they are ready for the school year, or moved in by Season to enjoy the fabulous lifestyle Palm Beach has to offer;   not only the fabulous weather, golf, shopping and amazing restaurants that are all open and ready to serve you and your family, it’s also the birds, the beach, the lovely people, The Kravis Center, The Society of the Four Arts, The Preservation Foundation, The Flagler Museum, The Norton Museum, all providing culture, theatre, and so many wonderful things to do.   We love it, and so does everyone else!

posts.title: Palm Beach Luxury Rentals…Homes, and Condominiums – Annual , Seasonal and Summer Rentals!
posts.author: Carolina Olsson
posts.content:
Dear Potential Buyers, Sellers, Clients, and Friends,

We have some fabulous rental options that are just coming available for both Palm Beach Homes  and Palm Beach Condominiums that will be available for Annual and Summer Rentals. 

Many of the below properties are available when the Seasonal Tenants vacate after this Season, call for details.

For those of you that would like to spend the rest of the Palm Beach Season here in sunny Palm Beach, we have a fabulous House situated on the Breakers Golf Course that is available 

now, February, March, and April, or one can lease it annually, or for the Summer.  Everyone loves this house, the Annual Tenants have moved to another city, and it’s your lucky day if you 

want to come for the balance of the Palm Beach Season!

229 Pendleton Avenue, Palm Beach , is lovely, and in the Perfect, In-Town Location, near the Beach, Houses of Worship, The Royal, the Bike Trail, on a quiet street, with fabulous views of the Breakers Golf Course.   

Palm Beach Homes for Lease, Annually, Seasonally, or for the Summer…

229 Pendleton Avenue, Palm Beach In Town-Trophy Property Overlooking the Breakers Golf Course…Rare Find!

Traditional, Renovated 4 BD/4 BA with 1 BD/1 BA Guest house. Custom Kitchen, Hardwood Floors, Fireplace and Pecky Cypress Loggia Overlooking 

the Pool  with Amazing Views of the Golf Course. Quiet One Way Street, Best Location in Town!   Annual $60,000 /Season $75,000/ Summer/$50,000

Available February, March, April for Season, or annually for a six months Summer Rental.

201 Pendleton Avenue, Palm Beach Sale or Lease; In-Town, Charming One Story Golf Villa Abutting The Breakers Golf Course

Fabul ous One Story Bermuda, 3 BD/2.5 BA. Wonderful Covered Loggia Overlooking  the Pool with Amazing Views of the Golf Course!   

Situated on Coveted  Pendleton Av e.  Walk to The Breakers, Schools, Houses of Worship, & Beach.   $30,000 Annual.

Available May 1, 2023, Annually $30,000 or for a 6 month Summer Rental.

210 Via Linda, Palm Beach$25,000 Per Mth. – Near North End – Lovely Furnished One Story Mid-Century Modern

Lovely 3 BD/3.5 BA with Pool Cabana/Extra Bedroom or Office.  Two Car Garage.  Private, Lushly Landscaped Yard and Pool Area.   

Near the Clubs/ Town!    Annual Lease $25,000 a month.

Available; May 1, 2023, or for 6 Month Summer Rental.

In-Town Condominium Rentals, Annual Lease, and one Summer Lease…

In-Town Oceanfront Condominium: 100 Worth Avenue, Palm Beach  Prestigious Winthrop House Penthouse available for lease, May to December 15, 2023

Fabulous Ocean Views! Furnished 2 BA/ 2BA, 1,539 sq. ft with New Kitchen and Baths, Porcelain Floors,  High Ceilings, and Impact Windows!   Pet Accepted.   

Full Service Building, Tunnel to the Beach, Great Gym,  Pool.   Best location in Town across the street from the Ocean at the Corner South Ocean Blvd, and Worth Avenue!

In-Town Oceanfront Condominium: 400 South Ocean Blvd, Palm Beach –Prestigious Landmarked Building Quiet Listing…

Just Renovated, New Furnishings too – 1 BD/1 BA Totally Renovated… all new! Comfortable Living Space, Eat-in Kitchen Too.  Fabulous Building by Architect, Edward Durell Stone 

Featuring the Town’s only Rooftop Pool, Laundry Room, and Gym. Unique Opportunity – Annual Lease Preferred.   Available Now for this Season too, or Summer lease. 

Asking $7,500 annually.   Contact us for other options.

We will have another Palm Beach Condominium rental coming up in May…

In-Town, Unit 312,  170 North Ocean Blvd, Palm Beach O cean Towers North, across the street from the Sun and Surf,  Stunning 1 BD/1BA, furnished unit, totally renovated.   

Currently leased for Season. 

Specializing in Palm Beach Luxury Condominiums and Condominiums.  The most desired Palm Beach condominiums and co-ops are in Town along South Ocean Boulevard 

from just  North of   The  Breakers, South to Worth Avenue, and along Lake Trail. These exclusive apartments provide fabulous views of the ocean and/or the Intracoastal waterway and yacht 

basin. The residences in this area  boast a sense of neighborhood and convenience blending into the commercial district of Worth Avenue for world-renown shopping and dining in a 

host of outstanding restaurants; all within walking  distance.   Below please find a general description of these Luxurious In Town Condominiums for your review.   We are proud to say our 

30 years of Experience in the sales and rentals units in these  sought after Palm Beach Luxury Units has been a pleasure.   We just listed and sold a One of a Kind, Penthouse unit at the 

Prestigious 100 Royal Palm Way Building.   There was only one!… We had  multiple  offers, and it sold for the asking price of $15,000,000.

Interested in Buying or Selling an In-Town Condominium in a Top Luxury Building in Palm Beach?  The Palm Beach Condominium Market is on Hot, Hot, Hot, and the most 

desirable Oceanfront  and Intracoastal Buildings close to Worth Avenue, and the In-Town Luxury Condominium market is strong, three bedroom units are almost impossible to find.   

Our relationships with owners and managers  of the buildings,   provide us with access to quiet listings.   Contact us for further information.   Please see some of the Top Tier

Palm Beach Condominiums below:

One Royal Palm – 100 Royal Palm Way, Palm Beach, FL  33480  

We are proud to say our 30 years of Experience in the sales and rentals units in these sought after Palm Beach Luxury Condominiums has been a pleasure. We just listed and 

sold a One of a Kind,  Penthouse unit at the Prestigious 100 Royal Palm Way Building.  There was only one!… We had multiple offers, and it sold for the asking price of $15,000,000.

Designed by Howard Chilton, this elegant, Park-Avenue style white glove condominium building situated on the corner of Royal Palm Way and South Ocean Blvd. has 39 units on 

6 floors and was built in  1969 . This exclusive building offers floor to ceiling windows, terraces, and fabulous ocean views. Two and three bedroom units, and occasionally a wonderful 

Penthouse is available.  This full service  building with manager, 24 hour doorman, pool and gym does not allow rentals. One small pet is permitted with restrictions. 

Application and Interview required.

Sun & Surf – 100 & 130 Sunrise Avenue, Palm Beach, FL  33480 Click Here To View All Listings

We sold the last two Penthouse units at Sun and Surf in the 130 Building with fabulous views, and approx. 1,000 sq. ft terraces… Both units were completely gutted and were ready

for occupancy in  November of 2022.  We have sold many units  in this sought after Direct Oceanfront Building… They sell quickly when they come available

One of the only Direct Oceanfront Full service buildings in Palm Beach. Designed by Eugene Lawrence in 1966…totally renovated in 2017/2018. Sun and Surf is one of only two buildings 

situated directly  on the beach, two buildings with a total of 136 units on 7 floors. This complex is unique in that it is truly full service, like living at a fine hotel. Two pools, with cabanas available 

for purchase, towel service,  pool attendants, full time manager, valet parking, garage, 24 hour doorman. The direct oceanfront building at 100 Sunrise does not allow pets, however the 

130 Building does allow one small pet with  restrictions. Allows rentals 1x/3 years with restrictions. Application and interview required.

Il Lugano – 300 Seminole Avenue, Palm Beach, FL  33480 

Exclusive, prestigious   top security building, Units in this Luxurious Direct Intracoastal Building are truly a Rare Find, situated directly on the intracoastal waterway built in 2002 

consisting of two  buildings  with 6 floors and various units of 3 to 5 bedrooms. One of the most exclusive buildings in Palm Beach, this full-service building features voluminous ceiling 

heights, fabulous city and water views,  direct intracoastal pool, 24 hour doorman, wine room, fitness center…true luxury for the discerning buyer. No rentals or pets.

Application and interview required.

Leverett House – 110 and 120 Sunset Avenue, Palm Beach, FL  33480 

Exclusive direct oceanfront condominium building designed by Mike Burrows in 1983 consisting of two buildings with 21 units per building. One of the only direct oceanfront 

buildings Palm Beach  proper, this complex is situated in a quiet location with a wonderful pool, in a full service building with guard, 24 hour doorman, and garage. Units varying in size,

location,  and price range. Some offer  magnificent direct oceanfront and others offer views of the Breakers golf course. Poolside cabanas are sometimes available for purchase. 

Allows one small pet with restrictions.  Rentals are allowed with  restrictions. Application and Interview required.

L’Ermitage – 200 Bradley Place, Palm Beach, FL  33480 

Exclusive In-Town Luxury Condominium, Elegant Direct Intracoastal building designed by Eugene Lawrence in 1985 consisting of 29 units on 5 floors, Rarely Available these 

units are highly  Desirable….The complex has two swimming pools – one directly on the Intracoastal waterway, a fitness center, tennis court, and garage. This full service building with 

a doorman does not allow pets  or rentals. Not often available, the units in this building range in square footage from 2,325 to 3,768. Prices range depending upon location and view. 

Application and interview required.

Dunster House – 360 South Ocean Blvd., Palm Beach, FL   33480 

Experience Fabulous Ocean Views from the Prestigious condominium building designed by Mike Burrows built in 1978 across from the ocean in the center of town just north of 

Worth Avenue. This  exclusive building has only 15 units on 6 floors providing privacy for the discerning buyer. Most units have outstanding ocean views and/or town views, 

and square footage is  approximately 2,500  total sq.ft.. Many units were originally 3 bedrooms, but may have been converted. Full service building with doorman, exercise room, 

pool, garage. Does not allow rentals.  Pets allowed 25 lbs or  under.. 

Application and interview required.

Lowell House – 340 South Ocean Blvd., Palm Beach, FL 33480 

Designed by Mike Burrows in 1975 this Elegant building has 29 units on 6 floors…Some units have been combined to create double units. Direct ocean views are outstanding. 

Two bedroom, two bath  units with high ceilings and occasionally Penthouses with large terraces suitable for entertaining are available. Excellent location in the center of town, 

walk to fine restaurants, Cafe L’ Europe, antique  shops, Worth Avenue and directly across from the life guarded public beach. Full service, manager, doorman, club house, 

pool, and garage. Allows rentals and pets with restrictions. 

Application and  Interview required.

Winthrop House – 100 Worth Avenue, Palm Beach, FL 33480 Click Here To View All Listings

Best Location in Town, Situated on World Renown Worth Avenue and South Ocean Blvd., this oceanfront condominium building designed by Mike Burrows in 1970 has 

1 21 units on 8 floors. Lovely  bleached wood paneled lobby area and receiving entry hall, excellent well run building,   Fabulous remodeled pool area on the third floor 

level and tunnel under South Ocean Boulevard with direct  entrance to the beach. Wonderful exercise room, club house room for entertaining, and garage parking. 

Best location in Palm Beach,  In Town on Worth Avenue for the finest shopping and dining  experiences in the Country. Full time manager, doormen and excellent security, 

allows one small pet.  Allows rentals 1x/2 years with restrictions.

The Villas – 425 Worth Avenue, Palm Beach, FL  33480 

One of the most prestigious buildings in Palm Beach, The Villas is an exclusive co-operative building that was completed in 1971. Located at the west end of Worth Avenue 

across the street from the  Everglades Club, the building has six floors and only twenty-seven units.. It’s unique location provides easy access to all the shops and restaurants, as well as a 

lovely view of the Intracoastal waterway  and Everglades Island from each of the units and penthouses. There are two and three bedroom units and three penthouses most of 

which have an additional  staff bedroom and bath This full service  prestigious co-op with a stunning lobby re imagined by the world-famous designer, Scott Snyder, 

provides top notch services with full-time manager, doormen, garage parking, and allows one pet up to  20 pounds. There are no rentals allowed. 

Application and interview are a requirement of this exclusive building.

330 Building – 330 S. Ocean Blvd., Palm Beach, FL  33480 Click Here To View All Listings

Exclusive full service condominium building on the ocean in the center of town. Built in 1979, with 29 units on 5 floors, this wonderful building offers many three

First and foremost, we are thinking of you and your families during this unprecedented time in our Nation.  At times like this, I defer to Sir Winston Churchill whose action and quotes during Britain’s darkest hours inspired the world and the British Empire to never surrender.  A few of my favorite Churchill quotes are below, I hope they inspire you as they do me.

 “For myself, I am an optimist – it does not seem to be much use being anything else.”

“Never give in, never give in, never, never, never, never—in nothing, great or small, large or petty—never give in except to convictions of honor and good sense” 

“Courage is what it takes to stand up and speak. Courage is also what it takes to sit down and listen.”

“Success consists of going from failure to failure without loss of enthusiasm.”

“The true guide of life is to do what is right.”

Specializing in Palm Beach Luxury Real estate for over 30 years, we are confident that Palm Beach is not only the very best place to live, but the very best way to invest your money to diversify your portfolio to Preserve your Wealth.  Florida’s Tax Benefits are truly the best to Florida Residents, one of only a few states that does not levy a State Income Tax, our sales taxes are low too.  With homestead benefits, no personal income tax, no inheritance tax, no gift tax, nor intangible personal tax.  Palm Beach is an ideal place to live and enjoy the tax benefits of owning real estate.  With interest rates the lowest in history, now is the time to buy in Palm Beach!

Palm Beach Real estate is and always has been the best investment you can make…during the Market Crash of 2008, prices slumped, but came roaring back.  Considering prices in New York, London, and other fashionable cities, Palm Beach real estate is a value.

According to Darryl Hoffheinz’s September 17, 2019 Article in the Palm Beach Daily News, Palm Beach County Property Appraiser Dorothy Jacks served up some history Monday during a breakfast talk at The Breakers that saw her emphasize how real estate values in the town of Palm Beach have for a century been eye-popping.

Palm Beach, she said, truly is a one-off. “Almost 400 properties on Palm Beach have an assessment greater than $10 million,” she said.  In the latest round of property valuations, the total market value assigned to about 9,500 individual “parcels” in town totaled $24.2 billion, she said. To further emphasize Palm Beach’s staying power, she pointed to the Great Recession, which gripped the country between 2007 and 2009 and caused real estate values nearly everywhere to plummet. In some cases, those values didn’t recover for a decade. “The distinction is that when the recession hit, Palm Beach didn’t really react,” Jacks said. “Palm Beach (property values) didn’t stop growing,” she said. “Palm Beach continued to grow, but much slower. It didn’t crash.”  Read full article here…Click to read full article here

Dear Potential Buyers, Sellers, Clients, and Dear Friends,

Labor Day is in the rear view mirror, the wonderful summers in Nantucket, the Hamptons, Capri, and the South of France are fleeting, and Fall is just around the corner! Now is the time everyone “Thinks Palm Beach”. Planning to enjoy the Season, one must prepare our homes, obtain a Seasonal Lease, or think about listing your property if you want to Sell.  Palm Beach Real estate is selling, we represented the Buyer of this fabulous Trump Plaza Grand Penthouse, one of only four like units with 12 ft. ceilings, and amazing views.  The owners will not be using the unit this year, and it will be available for a 6 month furnished Seasonal Lease, or an annual Lease.  Click on this link to preview the unit, contact us if you have an interest in leasing this rare find!

PLEASE CLICK THIS LINK TO PREVIEW FULL DETAILS AND PHOTOS…Click to view listing(s)

This summer has been unprecedented as it relates to Palm Beach Luxury Sales…According to the Palm Beach Daily News, an article written by Darryl Hoffheinz on August 9, 20119, Palm Beach high-end real estate sales are OFF THE CHARTS!

“Sales often close in Palm Beach during June and July, as house-hunters seal deals after shopping during the season. But this July amped up the stakes. Compare the $347 million in single-family sales that closed in July to the same month of the previous three years: July 2018 saw 14 single-family transactions in Palm Beach totaling $109.36 million, according to courthouse records. In July 2017, that number was $81.49 million for 16 homes. And July 2016 saw a total of $64 million generated by 10 single-family sales.

Analysts have to go back more than a year to find a month in which the official sales total even comes close to the one recorded last month. That would be April 2018 — at the height of the spring selling season — when documented transactions in town totaled about $249.4 million, with 25 single-family sales totaling $194 million and 41 condos adding another $55.4 million.

The sales lull of last season had caught many Palm Beach agents and brokers off guard. They were stunned when transactions practically ground to a halt last fall after nine months of go-go action that began when Congress passed the federal tax overhaul in December 2017. The tax changes gave a substantial boost to business and industry while benefiting affluent Americans, thanks to changes to the estate tax and the alternative minimum tax.

The changes also capped the federal deduction for property, state and local taxes at $10,000. That sent a wave of affluent residents in high-tax states — including New York, New Jersey and California — to shop for a primary residence in Florida and, in particular, Palm Beach, according to independent island broker Linda Olsson of Linda R. Olsson Inc. Echoing other brokers, Olsson said people have come to regard Florida as a tax haven, thanks to its favorable homesteading rules, its lack of a state income tax, its relatively low sales tax and its limited tax on intangible property.

“For wealth preservation, people certainly see Palm Beach as an option,” Olsson said.

Some have speculated that July’s sales may have been sparked, in part, by this year’s April 15 tax deadline, which marked the first time the tax-law changes were reflected on returns.

In addition to tax advantages, Olsson added, the island continues to offer home buyers its traditional attractions — security, beauty, fine architecture and favorable weather, especially during the winter months.”  Read the entire story here: https://www.palmbeachdailynews.com/news/20190809/exclusive-palm-beach-homes-july-real-estate-deals-set-record-at-374-million

We look forward to seeing you this Season. Contact us Today, we are available for you 24/7.

This month has been a continuation of the market pushing into high gear, with condominium sales beating the street as to prices per sq. foot due to lack of inventory at the $5 million and under market, leaving the inventory of condominiums priced under $4 million at a bare minimum of only 7 units. The lack of inventory at this price point is evident, as the condominium units are typically listed and sold within a week. Click here to preview listed “In-Town” condominiums for sale in Palm Beach. 

We are pleased to have sold the last 2 bedroom units listed at the prestigious Sun and Surf, 130 Sunrise Avenue building, we represented the buyers in both sales. Unit 415 was listed at $2,650,000 and is closing in February at almost the asking price. Unit 609 was listed at $2,495,000 and is closing this week.  Click here to preview the 1 active listing for sale and the pending listing in the building.

Across the street, at the 170 North Ocean Building, known as Ocean Towers, we represented the buyers in the 2 most recent sales. At the prestigious 400 South Ocean Blvd. Building, situated across from Midtown. Beach, one block from Worth Avenue… We listed and sold Unit 202, which will close in February at the asking price of $2,650,000. click to preview listing. Two Penthouses are also under contract: PHA; Asking: $6,500,000 and PHD; Asking $8,900,000.  Click here to preview  one active unit for sale, and the pending listings in the building.

“In-Town” Home prices have doubled in the past year… We listed and sold 218 Everglades Avenue… Asking $11,998,000. This fabulous 4 BD/4.5 BA is under construction and will be completed by the builder and the new buyer over the next 7 months. Click here to preview this home, which is under contract. The same builder, Dunworth Construction, built 307 Chilean Avenue, which we listed and sold in 2021 for $6.9 million, which just closed this week at $12 million to a new buyer! Click here to preview 307 Chilean Avenue closed listings.

posts.title: Record setting Palm Beach Real Estate Sales 2019… and Fourth Quarter Market Report
posts.author: Carolina Olsson
posts.content:
Dear Clients, Potential Buyers, Sellers, Friends and Associates:

Happy New Year! 2019 certainly was a record setting year for Palm Beach Real Estate…We are delighted to share Our Fourth Quarter Market report below, to read full report…Click this Link

4th Qtr. 2019 Market Report update:

Area 1: (Inlet Drive to Wells Road) 10 homes SOLD –
Average price: $10,054,717 – Average per sq. ft. $1,198
Highest priced per sq. ft. 1610 N Ocean Blvd – $2,278
Lowest priced per sq. ft. 232 Colonial Lane – $659

Area 2: (Wells Road to Worth Ave.) 7 homes SOLD –
Average price: $4,538 – Average per sq. ft. $1,078
Highest priced per sq. ft. 125 Chilean Ave – $1,225
Lowest priced per sq. ft.  236 Pendleton Ave – $517

Area 3: (Worth Avenue to Sloan’s Curve) 1 home SOLD –
Average price: $105,000,000 – Average per sq. ft. $1,241
Highest priced per sq. ft. 1415 S Ocean Blvd – $1,241
Lowest priced per sq. ft.  N/A

Area 1, 2, 3 TOWNHOUSES –  SOLD
Average price: $2,175,000 – Average per sq. ft. $1,132
Highest priced per sq. ft. N/A

Area 2: CONDOS (Worth Avenue to Wells Road) 20 condos SOLD
Average price: $1,977,197 – Average per sq. ft. $1,013
Highest priced per sq. ft. 100 Worth Ave– $1,847

Lowest priced per sq. ft 44 Cocoanut Row 324B – $343

Click here for details and photos of this In-Town Ocean Block Custom Home!

As 2019 started out, sales were a bit sluggish with a late December 2018 stock market plunge, China trade war global worries, and a federal government shutdown looming… but once we hit July of 2019, Palm Beach real estate sales were sizzling and we were off to the races in the Fourth Quarter. In fact, 2019 broke real estate records and grabbed headlines.  In December, the record breaking sale of beauty mogul Sydell Miller’s oceanfront home at 1415 South Ocean Blvd. located in Area 3, Billionaires Row, to Steve Schonfeld and his wife was an amazing end to 2019.

Just for the Record…let’s recap some of the biggest off market deals on the Island in 2019:  According to the Palm Beach Daily News article by, Darrel Hoffheinz, posted January 5, 2020;

1415 South Ocean Blvd., Billionaire’s Row, sold in December; $105 million, reportedly actually sold for $111 million in an off market sale.

1295 South Ocean Blvd., Billionaire’s Row, sold in June; $104.99 million.  Shattered a former island record for a single-buyer/single-seller transaction, which stood for more than a decade.

60 Blossom Way, Billionaire’s Row, sold in September; $99.13 million to Chicago hedge-funder, and part time Palm Beach resident, Ken Grifffin, who added to his adjacent holdings-now totaling more than 20 acres of mostly vacant acres.

The list of sold Palm Beach homes goes on and on, and on…..just to name a few:

1960 South Ocean Blvd., Billionaire’s Row; sold in August;  $43 million; Reported buyer, Steve Wynn/casino mogul.
1071 North Ocean Blvd., New Construction; sold in July; $40.87 million.
525 North County Road, Vacant Oceanfront Lot; sold in July; $37.29; seller linked to Russian billionaire Dmitry Rybolovelv.
101 Casa Bendita, Seaside Mansion, sold in July; $30,275; seller Robert V. Matthews lost in bankruptcy.
225 Indian Road, Direct Inlet/Intracoastal property, sold late December; $28.98 million.
980 North Ocean Blvd., $28.98 million; sold in April; $28.66 million.

What’s the bottom line… Palm Beach Real estate is HOT, HOT, HOT with so many headlines, including President Trump declaring his residency in Palm Beach along with many high net worth individuals and families fleeing high tax states such as California, Connecticut, and New York…just to name a few. Trump’s move will bring huge Tax Advantages by claiming Mara-Lago in Palm Beach as his official residence and homestead he has traded a high tax state, New York, for a low one.  According to the Palm Beach Daily News by  Jeff Ostrowski.., Dated November 1, 2019;

“As Florida’s business boosters have stressed for decades, the state collects no income tax. In contrast, New York City residents can owe state and city income taxes at rates topping 12 percent. The 2017 tax package championed by Trump raised the burden on New Yorkers, and on residents of other high-tax states, by ending a longstanding federal tax deduction on state and local taxes.

“There’s more of an incentive to come down here now, because you can’t deduct your state taxes,” said tax attorney Eugene Pollingue Jr. of Saul Ewing Arnstein and Lehr in West Palm Beach. “Every client I have, I recommend to them to become a Florida resident.”

In another contrast with New York, Florida has no estate tax, which is imposed on the wealthy when they die. New York, on the other hand, has a top estate tax rate of 16 percent.

Florida Tax Watch recently reported that residents of New York pay more in state and local taxes than residents of any other state. The group calculated New York’s annual tax burden at $11,810 per person. Florida ranked 40th, at $5,733.”

Read this article to learn the benefits of declaring Florida your residence. Read full article here: Click Here.

Specializing in Palm Beach Luxury Real Estate for over 30 years, let our expertise work for you… We pride ourselves in prompt, professional real estate services with our Local Expertise, Global Reach, and Unrivaled web site www.LindaOlsson.com

Whether you are Buying, Selling, or Leasing a Pied-A-Terre to an Oceanfront Estate in Palm Beach or the surrounding area, Preserve Your Wealth.. Relocate to Florida Today! Contact us for Experience you can Trust…We get results!

Watch Our Fabulous Ranch Video Here
Perfect For Family Fun and Social Distancing… This 450 Acre Trophy Property is only 40 minutes North of I-95, just West on scenic S.W. Martin Highway, a gorgeous thoroughfare bringing you directly to this wonderful ranch property. Quiet and peaceful, birds singing, ride your horses, enjoy your garden. Currently used as a weekend retreat, the property has a lease in place for Cattle to obtain the agricultural tax benefit too. This property is nature and Old Florida at it’s finest: gorgeous live Oakes, water Oakes, two ponds, Artesian well, 7 miles of recreational trails for off-road vehicles and a wonderful ranch office with four car garage. Priced at only $4,495,000, this is truly an opportunity of a lifetime.
 Click here for further details
You and your family will truly enjoy this rare find… Contact us today!

posts.title: Historic Palm Beach Homes For Sale
posts.author: Carolina Olsson
posts.content:
Dear Clients, Colleagues, Friends, and Family:
 
Happy Fourth of July!  We give thanks to our many veteran’s who have fought for our Country…before, during, and after the adoption of the Declaration of Independence on July 4, 1776.
This historic day brings to mind the many fabulous Palm Beach Landmarked homes built in the 1920’s  by world-famous architect’s… Addison Mizner, John Volk, Maurice Fatio, and Marion Sims Wyeth, who built Mar-A-Lago, the Winter White House. We thought it would be of interest to you to preview these outstanding offerings, which are listed for sale and available for purchase.  
Please click on the address of each property, to review the details and photos of each home:
 
1820 S. Ocean Blvd. Palm Beach, FL 33480
The Addison Mizner compound is a grand history landmark and is also a large scale luxury home that boasts fine luxury details. The already gorgeous home has recently had substantial interior renovations to make it into the modern masterpiece you see now. The home also has its own personal underground tunnel straight to the beach.
 
800 S. County Road, Palm Beach, FL 33480
Casa del Ensuenos is a rare direct lakefront estate made by famous American architect Addison Mizner located in the Estate Section. The estate was built in 1923 but has been updated into a contemporary masterpiece with modern amenities. The home boasts Venetian influences, six spacious bedrooms, and a three bedroom guest house. The home is a historical landmark so you will own a piece of history. The home also has its own dock with boat lift, large pool with cabana and tropical gardens.
930 S. Ocean Blvd., Palm Beach, FL 33480
This lovely estate was first built in 1927 and is one of the island’s greatest landmark residences. The home has been restored to perfection making you feel like you’ve travelled back in time. It has a perfect combination of old world grandeur and modern luxury amenities. It boasts amazing craftsmanship in not only the main house but also the guest house at the private courtyard pool. Lovely waterfront estate with stunning ocean views, gorgeous swimming pool, underground wine cellar, and deeded beach rights.
241 El Vedado Road, Palm Beach, FL 33480
This 5-bedroom, 6 and a half bathroom estate was built in 1927 but has been restored to perfection and meticulously maintained into the contemporary work of art that you see now. It boasts a gorgeous landscaped elevated garden, gourmet kitchen, 2 car garage, paneled library with fireplace, and an abundance of natural light. The master wing has dual baths, dual closets and a personal sitting room. There are many lovely outdoor entertaining areas such as the spacious sun bathed balconies, swimming pool, and the lovely elevated garden. Prime location on El Vedado Road, one of the three Palm Beach ”El” streets known for their architectural significance and proximity to Worth Avenue.
 255 Clarke Ave., Palm Beach, FL 33480
Built in 1928 by famous architect John Volk, this lovely landmark estate is located on the prestigious Clarke Avenue. The home boasts custom pecky cypress ceilings, custom hand painted cabinetry, with wide plank wood flooring giving it a feel of sophistication and luxury. It has been restored, maintained, and is in perfect condition.  Complete with a sun room, elevator, chef’s kitchen, family room, over sized multi-car garage, and living room with a fireplace. The main house has 4 bedrooms, and the guest house has 2 bedrooms. The loggias open to the sensational backyard with pool, fountain, cabana, and summer kitchen.
For Over 28 Years, we Specialize in Palm Beach Luxury Properties…from Pied’s A’ Terres to Oceanfront Estates.  We are here for you 24/7 to help you with all your real estate needs.  Click on our outstanding web site: LindaOlsson.com, to preview all properties for sale in every price range… Homes, Condominiums, Land, and Town homes. Please contact us to discuss your interest in any of these properties, we look forward to hearing from you.  We appreciate the opportunity to work with you. 
 
With Best Wishes to you and your family for a Happy, Healthy, Fourth of July… Enjoy!
Sincerely,
 
LINDA R. OLSSON
PRESIDENT/BROKER
LINDA R. OLSSON, INC., REALTOR
“SPECIALIZING IN PALM BEACH LUXURY PROPERTIES SINCE 1989”
101 BRADLEY PLACE SUITE 204A, PALM BEACH, FL 33480

Our Featured New Listings Today, are all priced under $3 million, and are in excellent move in condition!

389 South Lake Drive, Palm Beach: Location, Location, Location…Near Worth Avenue this Prestigious In-Town Co-Op has great intracoastal views too! -Stunning 5th floor 2 bedroom 2 bath, Just move in and enjoy!  The unit shows well and everyone loves the location, walking to the boat docks, clubs, restaurants and shopping! This spacious, renovated 2 bedroom 2 bath unit is in excellent condition with a fabulous custom kitchen, custom wood molding and paneled living room, lovely hardwood floors, great closet space and nice baths too.  The unit has a great feel, with lovely views of the Intracoastal, the Lagoon/Everglades Club golf course on Worth Avenue, and the West Palm Beach skyline to enjoy the wonderful sunsets! Asking: $2,850,000.

234 Pilgrim Road, West Palm Beach:  South Exposure, totally renovated 3 bedroom, 3 bath, pool home in the much sought after South of Southern East of Olive “SoSo” neighborhood, on a quiet cul-de-sac. This perfectly charming home features original Dade County Pine hardwood floors in excellent condition, high impact hurricane windows and doors, updated bathrooms and a remodeled kitchen with antique white cabinets, quartz countertops, and stainless appliances. The impact skylight in the living area provides wonderful natural light to the home.  French doors in the Master bedroom leads to a fully fenced, lushly landscaped backyard and heated swimming pool. This home has it all… Move in ready for your enjoyment today!  Fabulous neighborhood, walk to the Intracoastal too! We just sold the neighbor’s home at 222 Pilgrim, a 4 bedroom, 3.5 bath with no pool, renovated, on a larger lot. sold last month for close to the asking price of $2,595,000 at $2,375,000.  The homes in this desirable neighborhood are great investment opportunities as they rent quickly too!  Asking $1,695,000.

The Trianon – 1200 South Flagler Drive, PH-4, West Palm Beach: Don’t miss this fabulous Penthouse unit at The Trianon! One of a kind, stunning penthouse! Experience ocean, intracoastal, and views of the Palm Beach yacht basin from this chic, modern, renovated 1 bedroom, 2 bath Pied-‘A-Terre with a wonderful family Room or guest room in a ”Pinch”, open eat-in-kitchen, with ice machine, reverse osmosis water system, electric shades on all windows, tile floors and impact windows! Don’t miss this fabulous unit on S. Flagler Drive. Next to Bristol, La Clara, and Forte, this is your opportunity to be the ”New Palm Beach” under $1.5 million!  Asking $1,495,000.

It is hard to imagine it is the first week of Summer and the 4th of July is just around the corner…With best wishes to you and yours for a wonderful Summer! Thank you for your patronage, support, and friendship over the years, we appreciate your business and look forward to continuing our relationships with you, your friends and family.  Whether you are thinking about buying, selling, or leasing…Contact us for Experience you can Trust!

For 30 years… Specializing in Palm Beach Luxury Real Estate, we are available to assist you to locate the perfect property to suit your criteria.  Let’s discuss and preview some fabulous opportunities that may suit your needs…

133 HAMMON AVENUE…Best Location in Town, Lives like a townhouse…Pets accepted no weight restrictions!

Very Private… In-town ocean block. Two story townhouse/European Villa with 2 bedrooms 3.5 contemporary baths…Absolutely stunning! Gracious floor plan features master bedroom with his and her baths, high ceilings, great built-in closets, impact windows, with lovely wrap around garden/terrace. Low maintenance, $3,000 per quarter. Elevator shaft in place. . Lovely pool for the 5 Ocean Colony homeowners.

Great investment property…Lease often…Few restrictions. Leased $12,000 annually $17,000 Seasonally. Perfectly priced at $2,999,500.

Looking for an In-town Waterfront Townhouse? …Consider the only townhouse complex in Palm Beach on the Intracoastal Waterway…the Exclusive Villa Plati Complex,  Built in 1991 by renowned Palm Beach architect, Eugene Lawrence,  These 15 Luxury Town homes feature gorgeous Intracoastal views with the units overlooking the beautiful gardens with relaxing water fountains… leading to the intracoastal waterway swimming pool, and bike path, perfect to safely walk, bike ride, or push your baby carriage to either end of the Island!  These two story units live like a home, most with private two car garages, all with private elevators, four units have private pools too.  Very convenient location within walking distance to shops, restaurants, Publix, and beaches.  The Villas Plati complex has a great management team, maintenance service, gardening staff… Like a waterfront home without the hassle…Quarterly Maintenance fees vary with unit.

There is currently one unit for sale in this amazing Palm Beach townhouse complex…Please contact us for details and pricing.

Looking for an In-town Townhome near Worth Avenue?…Consider The Brazils… This prestigious complex is well regarded as a top location in town..

419-435 Brazilian Avenue, Palm Beach….Priced at $4.5 and up…

The Brazils is a townhome community. What makes Penthouse 5 at The prestigious Winthrop House situated on World Renown Worth Avenue and South Ocean Blvd. so special?  First and foremost, this unit’s South exposure with lots of natural light, and stunning views of the ocean, terracotta roofs, Everglades golf course, and peaks of the Intracoastal waterway.  The Penthouse units in the building offer wonderful high ceilings, which  makes a world of difference, compared to other units with 8 foot ceiling heights.

posts.title: The Palm Beach/West Palm Condo Market is Hot! Record Breaking Sales… Palm Beach Oceanfront Condos and More!

Dear Potential Buyers, Sellers, Clients, Friends, and Associates.

We are proud to announce a Record-Breaking Sale at The Plaza of The Palm Beaches…We Listed and Sold Grand Penthouse One… A 3 Bedroom 3.5 Bath North East Corner unit with fabulous views. Asking $10,495,000.  The last sale for a Penthouse; closed at $7.5 million.   Click here to preview sales of the largest units at The Plaza (formally Trump Plaza).

West Palm Beach has become the “New Palm Beach”, with prices skyrocketing on the Island of Palm Beach, many Palm Beachers have sold their homes to take advantage of the Seller’sMarket.  Moving  across the bridge to West Palm Beach causing prices there to implode.   The influx of Palm Beach families moving to WPB, coupled with the highflyers from New York moving their hedge fund offices there  has caused the West Palm Beach market to skyrocket in all areas including homes and condominiums on Flagler Drive, including El Cid, and SoSo (South of Southern East of Olive.)

Palm Beach has truly become the most sought-after real estate in the country with high-net worth continuing to flock here not only for the glorious lifestyle, weather, and fabulous amenities, but to preserve their wealth  from high tax states such as New Jersey, New York, California, and Connecticut.   The inventory of Palm Beach homes is at a record low, and for those who do not want to build, when land is scarce, expensive,  prices of commodities are at their height, and contractors are booked and labor is hard to find…Never mind the fact that one cannot find a refrigerator, impact windows, etc… for 6 months to a year or longer.  Buyers search for other alternatives, such as condominiums or rentals as they continue to search for homes or land to build a home, which may take two to three years under the current circumstances.

We are excited to share a Rare, In-Town Direct Oceanfront 4 Bedroom 4.5 Bath condominium that lives like an oceanfront home with you… This custom designed double unit features direct ocean views from all major rooms.  Two units have been combined and rebuilt as one unit, it is absolutely stunning!  Offered at $13,900,000 including designer furnishings, excluding art and personal belongings.  Wonderful pet friendly building, across the street from Midtown Beach, walk to restaurants, and Worth Avenue.  This unit is truly a WOW, AND MUST BE SEEN!  Just move in and enjoy.  Please contact us for your private showing, or we are pleased to Face Time with prospective buyers, as photos are not posted on the listing.  You won’t be disappointed; this unit is truly the most gorgeous apartment we have seen in town! Click on this link to preview details and photos

posts.title: Palm Beach Real Estate is the Best Investment..Don’t miss your opportunity to Buy Now!

posts.content:
Celebrating our 30th year, Specializing in Palm Beach Luxury Real Estate, known for honesty, superior customer service, in-depth knowledge of the market, and the best resource for Palm Beach Real estate. We are pleased to educate buyers and sellers by keeping you aware of market trends, relevant articles as to Palm Beach Real estate, and we are sure you will be interested in what Dorothy Jacks, the Palm Beach Property appraiser had to say at the first meeting of this Season’s Palm Beach Chamber of Commerce breakfast.

Palm Beach real estate prices have continued to rise in 2019, according to Dorothy Jacks, the Palm Beach County Property Appraiser.

Over the past 30 years, the market has continued to climb unlike many states in the North East where clients’ real estate assets have plummeted with values continuing to decline… particularly in New York and Connecticut due to high taxation. With Buyers fleeing to Florida, Palm Beach has benefited from the highest level of net domestic migration – bringing with it an influx of wealthy entrepreneurs and retirees attracted by the tax climate, with no income or estate tax.

According to Darryl Hoffheinz’s September 17, 2019 Article in the Palm Beach Daily News, Palm Beach County Property Appraiser Dorothy Jacks served up some history Monday during a breakfast talk at The Breakers that saw her emphasize how real estate values in the town of Palm Beach have for a century been eye-popping. 

Palm Beach, she said, truly is a one-off. “Almost 400 properties on Palm Beach have an assessment greater than $10 million,” she said.  In the latest round of property valuations, the total market value assigned to about 9,500 individual “parcels” in town totaled $24.2 billion, she said. To further emphasize Palm Beach’s staying power, she pointed to the Great Recession, which gripped the county between 2007 and 2009 and caused real estate values nearly everywhere to plummet. In some cases, those values didn’t recover for a decade. “The distinction is that when the recession hit, Palm Beach didn’t really react,” Jacks said. “Palm Beach (property values) didn’t stop growing,” she said. “Palm Beach continued to grow, but much slower. It didn’t crash.”  Read full article here…Click to read full article

Have you been thinking about Buying a home in Palm Beach? We have some outstanding values available, at under $3 million…don’t miss your opportunity to Buy now.

251 Park Avenue, which is literally the least expensive property on the Island, in accordance with the Palm Beach MLS.  This home is situated on a very quiet, one way street that is truly up and coming.  There are new homes being built on the street, several have undergone renovations, and a few new homes completed over the past several years.  With 2,700 sq. ft. this wonderful 7 bedroom, 5 bath home is in great move in condition with hardwood floors and a fireplace.  This house is ripe for a renovation to suit your needs, and/or you may build your dream home in this excellent location next to a lovely park, within walking distance to the lake trail, beach, the Breakers, restaurants, Publix and houses ofWorship. Don’t drive? According to the Palm Beach MLS, there are only 7 available homes in the North End, from Wells Road, North to Inlet Drive, considered entry level homes, and/or properties to be renovated or torn down to build your dream home priced at $3 million and under…

Coming in at the lowest price on the North End, is 229 Monterey Road, at an asking price of $2,100,000.  217 Debra Lane is next… clocking in at $2.5 million, with 300 Colonial just a notch above at $2,595,000.  1465 Laurie Lane, which is close to the aforementioned Debra Lane in the far North End priced at $2,795,000, with 260 Plantation, in the near North End priced at only $2,850,000, which is truly a great investment for this superior location.  Next in line is 220 Onondaga at $2,850,000, with the final North End home under $3 million; One story home at 209 List Road, priced at $2,975,000.  Searching for a North End home at under $3 million?  Click here to preview these outstanding opportunities: Click to view listing(s)

According to the Palm Beach MLS, there are only 7 available homes In-Town, from Wells Road, South to Worth Avenue, considered entry level homes, and/or properties to be renovated or torn down to build your dream home priced at $3 million and under…

The aforementioned 251 Park Avenue is the lowest priced home in Palm Beach, asking $1,595,000.  Next in line is 400 Seaspray Avenue at $2,295,000, 236 Pendleton in the center of town on a one street, in walking distance to Bethesda Church and Royal Poinciana Chapel, listed at $2,795,000.  An ocean block pied-a-terre at 125 Chilean Avenue priced at $2,875,000, 215 Seaspray walking distance to the Palm Beach Rec Center and schools on Seaview Avenue, priced at $2,995,000, and last but not least 223 Seminole priced at $3 million.  Searching for an in-town home at under $3 million?  Click here to preview these outstanding opportunities: Click to view listing(s)

posts.title: In-town Ocean Block “Jewel box”… Absolutely Stunning!
posts.author: Carolina Olsson
posts.content:
Dear Clients, Colleagues, Potential Buyers and Sellers,

We are proud to present to you our newest listing situated on the Ocean Block of Seminole Avenue, just steps from the Beach! This elegant “Jewel Box”  4 Bedroom 4.5 bath home with guest house/cabana features custom renovations throughout.

Gutted to the studs, with top quality impact windows, French doors, & two gas fireplaces, it was renovated with love and dedication by its present owners to bring this home built in 1921 back to its glory! It’s open floor plan opening to the fabulous pool, outside gas grill and fireplace made it a perfect home for entertaining their family and friends, which was an important part of the process.  Truly one of the best locations in town, private with a tranquil garden yet within walking distance to the Beach, the Bike Trail, The Breakers, Chez Jean Pierre, Houses of Worship, and The Royal, with its fabulous restaurants and shops… it doesn’t get better than this!

Please contact us to preview this exciting new property, exclusively listed with our firm; asking $5,200,000.

PLEASE CLICK ON THIS LINK TO PREVIEW FULL DETAILS AND PHOTOS

Featured in the Palm Beach Daily News on November 22, 2019, by Darrell Hofheinz, he describes this stunning new listing…

The two-story traditional-style house — clad in a creamy stucco with blue-gray window shutters — features a portico over the arched double doors, which are painted the same driftwood color as the shutters. The foyer opens to the dining room on the north, which is just adjacent to the kitchen and powder room. An area comprising the living room, library and stairway lies to the west of the foyer. Upstairs are a guest bedroom suite and the master suite, with its two bathrooms, dressing room, breakfast bar and closets.

Doors are mirrored in the master suite, where the bathrooms are appointed in marble with walls finished in Venetian plaster. The main master bathroom has double vanities, and since the second bathroom is off of the dressing room, that space could be repurposed as an additional guest bedroom suite, Emmett says. The master bedroom opens to a balcony, with circular stairs leading down to the backyard and pool area.

The area features a saltwater pool and a covered loggia with a barbecue grill and gas fireplace and a poolside pergola. Anchoring one end of the pool, the guest cottage is attached to the one-car garage. A porte-cochere leading to the garage provides covered parking on the west side of the house. Interior features include a gas-powered fireplace in the living room and built-in cabinetry in the library.

Throughout are arched French doors and moldings, as well as the original Dade County pine floors, which Emmett had pulled up, sent away to be refinished and then reinstalled. The floors have been stenciled in the foyer, dining room, stair landing and upstairs hall.The kitchen is detailed with cream wood cabinetry, stainless-steel professional-grade appliances, a Jerusalem-stone floor, a butler’s pantry and marble countertops and backsplash.

Read the full story here, as it’s owner recounts the painstaking renovation, and the love of the property, it’s location, and enjoyment the home provided them and their family over the years… Read Full Story

posts.title: Palm Beach Real Estate Third Quarter Market Report, Stay Ahead of the Curve
posts.author: Carolina Olsson
posts.content:
The Palm Beach Real estate market continues to be strong, as high net worth Buyers continue their desire to enjoy the many benefits of the Palm Beach Lifestyle and take advantage of the many tax benefits provided by residing in Florida. With California, New York, New Jersey and other states continuing to raise taxes on homeowners, Preserve Your Wealth relocate to Florida:  No State Tax, No Inheritance Tax, No State Income Tax, No Flip Tax, No Salt Tax.  Please consult your tax advisor, and preview the report provided to us by Wilmington Trust, by clicking this link.

We are delighted to have Listed and Sold Penthouse A at 100 Royal Palm Way, Palm Beach in record time.  We had multiple offers and sold the Penthouse on September 15, 2022 for the asking price of $15,000,000…It was truly a once in a lifetime opportunity with an over 3,000 sq. foot wrap-around terrace and unobstructed ocean views from every room! We represented the Buyers and the Sellers in this exclusive transaction.The Facts are…Inventory is Low, Demand is High, and Prices remain Strong.  P alm Beach is a unique market, a community that “Everyone who’s Anyone” wants to be and they are willing to pay for it! Prices have Skyrocketed over the past several years since the arrival of the Coronavirus in the Spring of 2020.   The interesting thing is…Now that so many people from the Northeast have actually relocated to Palm Beach, they love the Town, the Palm Beach Community, and the Lifestyle, and they are bringing their friends and family, which is changing the dynamics to a younger crowd desiring to raise their families here.   Demand is causing a continuing tightening of the market as inventory for single family homes is the lowest it has been in years, with only 12 homes for sale In-Town from Worth Avenue to Wells Road, 27 homes for sale in the North End from Wells Road to Inlet Drive, and in the Estate Section, there are only 5 homes listed for sale.   Palm Beach’s turbocharged market saw eager buyers scrambling to find homes to suit their needs, and many of those buyers have opted to take rental homes or condominiums as they “hurry up and wait” for their dream home to become available.

 We have something for everyone from Pied’s-A-Terre to Oceanfront Estates, they are just harder to find. For example, on South Ocean Blvd, between Worth Avenue and The Breakers, there are 3 Direct Oceanfront units for sale. At the prestigious One Breakers Row, there are 4 units available from $9.5 million to $22 million.

Recapping the Uber High-End Palm Beach Market this summer, and the same montra continues…Tight Supply, Big Demand! From $30 million to $86 million, these are the top Ten Home Sales that sold “off-season” since May in Palm Beach. Many of these sales are sold “off market “, and are never officially listed “for sale”.  At $85.98 million, 901 North Ocean; $72.85 million, 102 Jungle Road; $56 million, 325 Via Linda; $46 million, 662 Island Drive; $44.88 million, 2315 S. Ocean Blvd.; $44.375 million; 1320 N. Lake Way; $39.9 million, 1020 N. Lake Way; $36.5 million, 625 Crest Road; $32.525 million, 1494 N. Lake Way; $31.25 million, 640 Island Drive.  According to the article published by the Palm Beach Daily News on April 16, 2022 regarding the newest Forbes 400 List,  ” A record setting 54 billionaires have been identified as having strong residential ties to the island”.We are pleased to share our Third Quarter Market Report with you.  The limited inventory of homes for sale in Palm Beach is evident by the sales recorded this quarter in addition to the fact that this summer, everyone was traveling after Covid restrictions have finally been lifted, and travel was most definitely on the agenda for everyone! Please click on the link to preview our Third Quarter Market Report.

With November just around the corner, Buyers are actively searching for properties to move into this Season!  Activity is picking up in Town and across the bridge, as everyone is coming back from the Hamptons, Nantucket, and all their European travels this summer!  The car carriers are back, restaurants are booking up, and the social calendar is going to be on fire this season!
